reviews.review_msg: Thick Russian accent, uploaded lecture slides and audio recordings but no video, which sucked for when he'd write on the blackboard. Mandatory use of 1 textbook but he recommended to use another one also. Asked for an hour of reading before each lecture. Generous marking. Messy teaching style with frequent typos but overall good prof. Curved me up

His lectures weren't the worst, but they weren't the best either. He had an annoying tendency to redefine variables without telling you so his derivations were pretty confusing. There were some irritating little 5-minute quizzes you had to speedrun every week too. On the bright side, everything was open-book, and midterms were take-home.

At first I thought Frolov was a great professor, then he went on long-term medical leave and Stephanie Simmons took over. Turns out we were VERY far behind. By comparison, Frolov's lectures seemed unfocused, unclear, and unorganized. He is, however, a really funny and pleasant guy.

Funny guy, terrible professor. Here's why. 1. the lecture is done on chalkboard only 2. His handwriting is messy 3. Will often forget variables while writing equations 4. Talks a lot while writing equations so prepare to multitask 5. the equations in the textbook and his lecture rarely match (use different forms)
Awesome prof and will answer all your questions.

Absolutely fantastic prof. He may seem a little nervous, but he's a pleasure to talk to. Genuinely interested in the subject and willing to help you out, but won't give you the answers. Tests are extremely fair. Great lectures and tough but interesting assignments. I wish he taught more upper level courses - I'd definitely love to have him again.

One of my favorite profs!! We used a flipped classroom where we taught ourselves the material and then she explained what was didnt understand in lecture and it worked really well. Her explanations make even complicated stuff seem easy and all exam questions are similar to the worksheets! If you are willing to participate you will do great

After Andrei Frolov's medical leave, Stephanie was a blessing. Her class was very well developed and organized. It felt like she was really paying attention to the needs of the students. There were fun demos every class.
Very nice to students. Strict but on a good level. If I was to rate this on a scale from 3 to 16 I would rate it a 16/16

David is a pretty good professor overall. Cares a lot about his students and wants everyone to succeed. My one small complaint is that sometimes there aren't many examples that can be used to approach his assignments which can take a while occasionally. Luckily his midterms and finals follow pretty closely to the assignments so stick to those.

An awesome prof. He is really easy to talk to about the course and will take the time to make sure u understand the material, if not in lecture, then after in his office. Gives very challenging homework sets that take days to do, but he believes in hard homework and simple tests, and he sticks to this. If u can do the HW u'll nail the mid + final.

Great Prof!! I learned a lot.  Lectures were really great. He is very helpful and friendly. Demo were great, too. Ok, assignments and tutorial were not easy, but don't worry to much about them, just try to do your best (this class really deserve it) and enjoy learning. He is one of the best teacher in SFU
Not a bad guy. Teaches reasonably well. Not the greatest, not the worst. Go to class though.

After a class with dodge, you will be so comfortable with all the material. Make sure you do the readings as he likes class input during  lectures. A great guy, wants you to learn a lot, just make sure you are good at math.
